Assignment1

Class Server

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.lang.Thread
      • Assignment1.Server
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread
    A class that models a TicTacToe server. The server performs most computational tasks for the game, then simply relays to the clients what they should now display.
    Author:
    jwiner

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run()
        The "main" function of the server thread. It is responsible for reading from and writing to the clients, and disconnecting clients when appropriate
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable
        Overrides:
        run in class java.lang.Thread

      • acceptClients

        private void acceptClients()
        Sets up the server's socket and accepts 2 clients.

      • disconnectClients

        private void disconnectClients()
        Closes the sockets and streams of all clients

      • decodeMessage

        private int decodeMessage(int message)
        Interprets the message sent from a client. If the move was valid, record it.
        Parameters:
        message - The client's move encoded in an integer
        Returns:
        An integer X (between 0 and 8) corresponds to a valid move made to square X.
        An integer 3X (between 30 and 38) means that the client attempted to make a move to the previously occupied square X, and thus no changes were made to the game.

      • sendMessages

        private void sendMessages(int message)
        It sends a detailed message back to each client through the sockets about how to alter their Gui to match the current state of the game.
        Parameters:
        message - The client's move encoded in an integer

      • isGameOver

        private int isGameOver()
        Checks to see if the game has been completed yet
        Returns:
        -1 = The game has not yet ended.
        0 = client 1 has won.
        1 = client 2 has won.
        3 = Draw
